cold.description: The common cold is a mild viral infection affecting the nose and throat. It spreads through droplets, shared surfaces, or close contact.
cold.remedy: Drink warm fluids, inhale steam, rest well, and avoid cold drinks. Seek a doctor if symptoms last more than a week.
cold.prevention: Wash hands regularly, avoid touching your face, and maintain distance from sick individuals.

fever.description: Fever is a rise in body temperature usually caused by infection. It is the body's natural way to fight germs.
fever.remedy: Stay hydrated, rest, take paracetamol if needed, and monitor temperature. Seek medical help if fever lasts more than 3 days.
fever.prevention: Maintain hygiene, drink clean water, and avoid contact with infected persons.

back pain.description: Back pain is commonly caused by muscle strain, poor posture, or long hours of sitting.
back pain.remedy: Stretch gently, maintain posture, use a firm mattress, and apply warm compresses.
back pain.prevention: Exercise regularly, avoid heavy lifting, and sit upright with back support.

neck pain.description: Neck pain often arises from poor posture, sleeping incorrectly, or stress.
neck pain.remedy: Stretch slowly, rest the neck, apply a warm cloth, and avoid long screen time.
neck pain.prevention: Maintain proper posture and take regular breaks while working.

headache.description: Headaches are a common discomfort caused by stress, dehydration, eye strain, or lack of sleep.
headache.remedy: Drink water, rest in a quiet dark room, avoid screen time, and apply a cold or warm compress.
headache.prevention: Stay hydrated, manage stress, maintain regular sleep schedules, and avoid skipping meals.

stomach pain.description: Stomach pain is usually caused by indigestion, gas, or eating unhygienic food.
stomach pain.remedy: Drink warm water, eat light foods, avoid spicy or oily meals, and rest. Seek medical help if pain worsens.
stomach pain.prevention: Wash hands, avoid street food, and eat freshly cooked meals.

skin rashes.description: Skin rashes may appear due to allergies, heat, pollution, or mild infections.
skin rashes.remedy: Keep the area clean, avoid scratching, apply aloe vera or cool compress.
skin rashes.prevention: Use clean clothing, avoid harsh chemicals, and maintain good hygiene.

hydration.description: Proper hydration supports every function of the body including circulation and temperature control.
hydration.remedy: Drink 6–8 glasses of water daily and increase intake during heat or exercise.
hydration.prevention: Carry water outdoors and avoid caffeinated or sugary drinks.

nutrition.description: Good nutrition helps the body stay energized, fight infections, and maintain healthy growth.
nutrition.remedy: Eat fruits, vegetables, whole grains, proteins, and avoid excess sugar or processed foods.
nutrition.prevention: Plan meals and include natural fiber-rich foods regularly.

mental health.description: Mental health affects how we think, feel, and handle stress. It is essential for overall well-being.
mental health.remedy: Talk to trusted people, practice relaxation, take breaks, and seek help if distress continues.
mental health.prevention: Maintain sleep schedule, exercise, and limit screen time.

stress.description: Stress is the body’s response to pressure. Long-term stress can affect both physical and mental health.
stress.remedy: Practice deep breathing, meditation, short breaks, and light exercise.
stress.prevention: Create balance between work and rest and maintain daily routines.

anxiety.description: Anxiety is a feeling of fear or discomfort and can affect sleep and concentration.
anxiety.remedy: Do breathing exercises, avoid caffeine, and engage in calming activities.
anxiety.prevention: Practice positive routines and stay physically active.

emergency.description: Emergencies include severe injury, unconsciousness, chest pain, or major bleeding.
emergency.remedy: Stay calm, ensure safety, call emergency numbers (112/108), and provide first aid if trained.
emergency.prevention: Learn basic first-aid skills and avoid risky situations.

cpr.description: CPR is a lifesaving technique used when a person is not breathing or has no heartbeat.
cpr.remedy: Call emergency services immediately. Push hard and fast in the chest at 100–120 compressions/min.
cpr.prevention: Take certified CPR training and keep emergency numbers handy.

fatigue.description: Fatigue is extreme tiredness often caused by overwork, dehydration, or poor sleep.
fatigue.remedy: Rest well, stay hydrated, and eat energy-rich foods like bananas and nuts.

injuries.description: Minor injuries include cuts, scrapes, and bruises from daily accidents.
injuries.remedy: Clean with water, apply antiseptic, use a bandage, and avoid touching the wound.
injuries.prevention: Wear protective gear when needed and keep surroundings safe.

burns.description: Burns damage the skin due to heat, chemicals, or electricity.
burns.remedy: Run cool water over the burn for 20 minutes. Do NOT apply ice, oil, or toothpaste.
burns.prevention: Be careful with hot liquids and keep children away from stoves.

first aid.description: First aid offers immediate support for injuries or sudden illness.
first aid.remedy: Stop bleeding with pressure, clean wounds, support breathing, and stay calm.
first aid.prevention: Learn basic first-aid skills and keep a kit at home.
